missing.summary: IDE CLI command '{{cmd}}' was not found in your PATH.

instructions.VS_CODE:
To install the '{{cmd}}' command:
1. Download, install and open Visual Studio Code
2. Open the Command Palette (⌘ + ⇧ + P on Mac, Ctrl + Shift + P on Windows/Linux)
3. Type 'shell command' to find 'Shell Command: Install '{{cmd}}' command in PATH'
4. Run the command and restart your terminal
instructions.CURSOR:
To install the '{{cmd}}' command:
1. Download, install and open Cursor
2. Open the Command Palette (⌘ + ⇧ + P on Mac, Ctrl + Shift + P on Windows/Linux)
3. Type 'shell command' to find 'Shell Command: Install '{{cmd}}' command in PATH'
4. Run the command and restart your terminal
instructions.WINDSURF:
To install the '{{cmd}}' command:
1. Download, install and open Windsurf
2. Open the Command Palette (⌘ + ⇧ + P on Mac, Ctrl + Shift + P on Windows/Linux)
3. Type 'shell command' to find 'Shell Command: Install '{{cmd}}' command in PATH'
4. Run the command and restart your terminal
instructions.ZED:
To install the '{{cmd}}' command:
1. Download and install Zed from https://zed.dev
2. The CLI is documented at https://zed.dev/features#cli
3. Follow the instructions for your platform
instructions.INTELLI_J:
To install the '{{cmd}}' command:
1. Download and install IntelliJ IDEA
2. Follow the instructions at https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/working-with-the-ide-features-from-command-line.html
3. The command line launcher should be set up during installation
instructions.XCODE:
To install the '{{cmd}}' command:
1. Install Xcode from the Mac App Store
2. The '{{cmd}}' command should be automatically available after installation
3. If not, you may need to run: sudo xcode-select --install
instructions.CUSTOM:
Custom command '{{cmd}}' not found in PATH.
Please ensure the command is installed and available in your system PATH.
